histogram.name: Autocheckout.Bubble
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of user interactions with the Autocheckout bubble, which prompts users to invoke Autocheckout on supported websites.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.BuyFlow
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of final states reached in Autocheckout buy flow.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.DismissalState
histogram.summary: The state of the Autocheckout dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow, or filling process, concluded.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration.Failed
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow concluded, in cases where the flow failed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.FlowDuration.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user submitted the Autocheckout dialog and when the Autocheckout flow concluded, in cases where the flow succeeded.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.InitialUserState
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.PopupInDialog
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.Security
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the Autocheckout dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an Autocheckout dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiEvents
histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the Autocheckout dialog UI.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the Autocheckout UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WalletErrors
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration.Failed
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file in case the download was failed.

histogram.name: Autocheckout.WhitelistDownloadDuration.Succeeded
histogram.summary: Measures time taken to download the Autocheckout whitelist file in case the download was succeeded.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions shown in the Autofill popup.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarAccepted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was accepted.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarDenied
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was denied.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card info bar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
histogram.summary: Measures the adoption of the HTML autocomplete type hint specification (see http://is.gd/whatwg_autocomplete for more details). For each fillable form detected, logs whether that form includes author-specified type hints.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ProfileCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.StoredProfileCount.
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill address profiles a user has.

histogram.name: AutoFill.Quality
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.Quality.
histogram.summary: The quality of the AutoFill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: AutoFill.RequestErrorimcklfaapmppdhilegjoahjbahdgfhcn
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: AutoFill.RequestSuccessimcklfaapmppdhilegjoahjbahdgfhcn
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query.
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Upload
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received at the time of an Autofill upload.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerQueryResponse.
histogram.summary: The usefulness of AutoFill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.summary: The usefulness of Autofill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCount
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured at launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.UserHappiness
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of various events in the Autofill user interaction flow. By comparing frequencies, we can compute several interesting "user happiness" metrics.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ConnectedDeviceCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of simulataneously connected Bluetooth devices. Used to direct testing efforts, and by our UI team to determine appropriate UI sizes.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingMethod
histogram.summary: Records the method used to pair each Bluetooth Device. Used to direct our testing efforts.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of pairing each Bluetooth Device. Used to understand whether we are having significant problems with Bluetooth pairing and seeing errors more commonly than we should.

histogram.name: Cellular.ActivationFailure
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device activation failures (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ActivationTry
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device activation tries (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ConnectionFailed
histogram.summary: The count of cellular reconnect failures during activation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.ConnectionRetry
histogram.summary: The count of cellular device reconnect tries during activation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupFailed
histogram.summary: The count of successful cellular plan established (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupStart
histogram.summary: The count of initiated cellular device setup starts (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.MobileSetupSucceeded
histogram.summary: The count of failed cellular plan setup tries (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.PaymentFailed
histogram.summary: The count of failed cellular plan purchases (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Cellular.PaymentReceived
histogram.summary: The count of successfully completed cellular plan purchases (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Clipboard.IncognitoUseCase
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 4/2013, experiment confirmed correctness of our patch.
histogram.summary: Counts how often the user writes or reads from the clipboard and whether the write was from an incognito window or not.

histogram.name: Cookie.ReinstatedCookies
histogram.summary: The duration in seconds between a cookie getting evicted (due to the number of cookies exceeding a domain limit), and subsequently reinstated.

histogram.name: Cros.ClickOnShelf
histogram.summary: Chrome OS shelf clicks.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.ArchiveType
histogram.summary: The type of archive file that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.DeviceMediaType
histogram.summary: The media type of removable device that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: CrosDisks.FilesystemType
histogram.summary: The type of file system that Chrome OS cros-disks daemon is requested to mount.

histogram.name: DiskCache.TotalIOTime
histogram.summary: The total time it takes to perform a payload IO operation, for the regular disk cache.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadedCount
histogram.summary: Number of certs loaded from domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent loading domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, on disk, of the domain bound cert database as it is being loaded.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GenerateCertTime
histogram.summary: Time spent generating a domain bound cert.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTime
histogram.summary: Combined time for GetDomainBoundCert retrieval (both synchronous and asynchronous).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeAsync
histogram.summary: Time for asynchronous retrieval (from the GetDomainBoundCert call until completion callback is called).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeSync
histogram.summary: Time for synchronous GetDomainBoundCert cert retrieval.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetDomainBoundCertResult
histogram.summary: Result of GetDomainBoundCert function.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.KillDatabaseResult
histogram.summary: Whether the domain-bound certs sqlite database was killed succesfully when an unrecoverable error was detected.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.Support
histogram.summary: Counts of SSL client sockets broken down by support for Domain Bound Certificates TLS extension. Counts only connections with full handshakes, resumed sessions are not counted.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskMaxWaitTime
histogram.summary: Longest time spent by requests waiting for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskWaitCount
histogram.summary: Number of requests that waited for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: Drive.CacheDBOpenStatus
histogram.summary: Status of drive cache metadata database open.

histogram.name: Drive.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.EntryKind
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: Drive.FileFormat
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific file formats for regular files. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: Drive.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBInitResult
histogram.summary: Result of drive resource metadata database initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBOpenExistingResult
histogram.summary: Result of attempt to open existing drive resource metadata database.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions.

histogram.name: Extensions.FunctionCalls
histogram.summary: Number of calls to extension functions.

histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser opening mode.

histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to scan a directory. Measured on every File Browser directory change.

histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder on startup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of files and directories in the Downloads directory (not including the contents of nested directories). Computed every time the File Browser current directory changes to Downloads.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser is an built-in extension without a background page. Its main.html file is loaded every time the user opens a File Browser tab or a file chooser dialog. The file is fairly large and the initialization is pretty expensive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OpeningFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened through browser.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.DisplayTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to display an image. Measured from the moment the user selected the image till the moment it is displayed (not counting the low resolution preview).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.FileType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the type of the file opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the way the image has been loaded.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to load an image from a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the result of a file save operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to save an image to a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MB
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image file in megabytes. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MPix
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image in megapixels. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Tool
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the button which the user clicked.

histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the number of photos imported. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportPercentage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the percent of photos imported among all the photos on the device. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to load the action dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment user see all available actions for the device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Scan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to scan the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from Files.app.

histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: HttpCache.OfflineStatus

histogram.name: Linux.GlibcVersion
histogram.summary: The version of glibc used. (Linux only)

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererEvents
histogram.summary: Captures statistics for various AudioRendererImpl events.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedAudioCodec
histogram.summary: Audio codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.DetectedVideoCodec
histogram.summary: Video codec used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderError
histogram.summary: Counts of video decode errors reported to plugin.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderPictureCount
histogram.summary: Number of PictureBuffers/textures requested per hardware decoder creation. This value varies by platform and video. A user visible video may trigger multiple decoder creations (sometimes every 5 seconds) but would normally not hold more than 2 sets of buffers at any given time in memory.

histogram.name: Media.PepperVideoDecoderPictureHeight
histogram.summary: Vertical video resolution rounded to the nearest bucket. (Corresponds roughly to the number in 720p.)

histogram.name: Media.VAVDAH264.DecoderFailure
histogram.summary: Error codes reported by video decode using VA-API hardware video decoder.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.DeviceMemoryClass
histogram.summary: Value of getMemoryClass() recorded once upon startup. This is an integer, device-specific constant correlated with the amount of memory available on Android device.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.EvictionReason
histogram.summary: Reasons behind evictions of individual tabs, recorded upon each tab eviction.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowMemoryLoadedTabCount
histogram.summary: Number of loaded (memory-resident) tabs when LowMemory notification is delivered.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowMemoryTimeBetween
histogram.summary: Time between two consecutive LowMemory notification in one foreground session.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.NotificationBackground
histogram.summary: Memory notifications delivered through system callbacks to Chrome while in the background.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.NotificationForeground
histogram.summary: Memory notifications delivered through system callbacks to Chrome while in the foreground - we count LowMemory notification vs particular levels of TrimMemory foreground notification.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Net.AsyncResourceHandler_PendingDataCount
histogram.summary: The count of unacknowledged ResourceMsg_DataReceived messages. This message is sent once per chunk of data read from the network.

histogram.name: Net.AsyncResourceHandler_PendingDataCount_WhenFull
histogram.summary: The count of unacknowledged ResourceMsg_DataReceived messages at the point where we pause network loading.

histogram.name: Net.AsyncResourceHandler_SharedIOBuffer_Alloc
histogram.summary: The size of a SharedIOBuffer allocation.

histogram.name: Net.AsyncResourceHandler_SharedIOBuffer_Used
histogram.summary: The number of bytes copied into a SharedIOBuffer.

histogram.name: Net.AsyncResourceHandler_SharedIOBuffer_UsedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of a SharedIOBuffer allocation that is actually used.

histogram.name: Net.AuthGenerateToken_basic
histogram.summary: The time to generate a Basic HTTP authentication token.

histogram.name: Net.AuthGenerateToken_digest
histogram.summary: The time to generate a Digest HTTP authentication token.

histogram.name: Net.AuthGenerateToken_negotiate
histogram.summary: The time to generate a Negotiate (or SPNEGO) HTTP authentication token.

histogram.name: Net.AuthGenerateToken_ntlm
histogram.summary: The time to generate an NTLM HTTP authentication token.

histogram.name: Net.CertificatePinSuccess
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional "pinning" requirements on a per-domain basis. This records the fraction of successful matches between a certificate chain and a pin list.

histogram.name: Net.CoalescePotential
histogram.summary: The number of times we sent N packets, but could have sent N-1 packets.

histogram.name: Net.ComodoDNSExperimentFailureTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken before we failed to resolve the Comodo test DNS record. This is an experiment, run in conjuction with Comodo, to test the viability of a DNS based certificate revocation mechanism.

histogram.name: Net.ComodoDNSExperimentSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to successfully resolve the Comodo test DNS record. This is an experiment, run in conjuction with Comodo, to test the viability of a DNS based certificate revocation mechanism.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.NoProxy.BytesAfterCompression
histogram.summary: The uncompressed number of bytes received per request that was compressed. Only includes requests which did not go through an explicit proxy and did not go over SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.NoProxy.BytesBeforeCompression
histogram.summary: The compressed number of bytes received per request that was compressed. Only includes requests which did not go through an explicit proxy and did not go over SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.NoProxy.ShouldHaveBeenCompressed
histogram.summary: The uncompressed number of bytes received per request that was not compressed but appears to have been compressible. Only includes requests which did not go through an explicit proxy and did not go over SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.Proxy.BytesAfterCompression
histogram.summary: The uncompressed number of bytes received per request that was compressed. Only includes requests sent through a proxy without SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.Proxy.BytesBeforeCompression
histogram.summary: The compressed number of bytes received per request that was compressed. Only includes requests sent through a proxy without SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.Proxy.ShouldHaveBeenCompressed
histogram.summary: The uncompressed number of bytes received per request that was not compressed but appears to have been compressible. Only includes requests sent through a proxy without SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.SSL.BytesAfterCompression
histogram.summary: The uncompressed number of bytes received per request that was compressed. Only includes requests sent over SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.SSL.BytesBeforeCompression
histogram.summary: The compressed number of bytes received per request that was compressed. Only includes requests sent over SSL.

histogram.name: Net.Compress.SSL.ShouldHaveBeenCompressed
histogram.summary: The uncompressed number of bytes received per request that was not compressed but appears to have been compressible. Only includes requests sent over SSL.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionTypeCount
histogram.obsolete: The count was inaccurate (it counted transactions rather than connections)
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of connections of a particular type that the user has had during the session.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionTypeCount2
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of successful connections of a particular type that the user has had during the session.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionTypeCount3
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of successful connections of a particular type that the user has had during the session.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionTypeFailCount2
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of failed connections of a particular type that the user has had during the session.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionUsedSSLv3Fallback
histogram.summary: True if the HTTP request was to a server which requires SSLv3 fallback

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionUsedSSLVersionFallback
histogram.summary: Nonzero if the HTTP request was to a server which requires SSL version fallback. The value indicates the SSL version the request fell back on.

histogram.summary: Whether or not updates to the backing store succeeded or failed, recorded every update.

histogram.name: net.CookieBetweenAccessIntervalMinutes
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: Intervals between access time updates for each cookie.

histogram.name: net.CookieCount
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: Number of cookies in the store (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time)

histogram.name: net.CookieDeletionCause
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: For each cookie removed from the store, the reason it was removed.

histogram.name: net.CookieDomainCount
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: For each domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: net.CookieDomainPerEtldp1Count
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of subdomains in that top level domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: net.CookieEtldp1Count
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: net.CookieEvictedLastAccessMinutes
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: For each evicted (not expired) cookie, the amount of time since it was last used

histogram.name: net.CookieExpirationDurationMinutes
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: Number of minutes until cookie expires when set.

histogram.name: net.CookieTimeGet
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to get cookies for each URL request.

histogram.name: net.CookieTimeLoad
histogram.obsolete: Initial typo; only here to get results from builds before r59117. See "Cookie." group.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to load the persistent cookie store at browser start.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfAlternateProtocolServers
histogram.summary: The total number of severs to which alternative protocol was used. This counts the number of servers persisted to prefs file.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfPipelineCapableServers
histogram.summary: The total number of severs that support HTTP pipelining. This counts the number of servers persisted to prefs file.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfSpdyServers
histogram.summary: The total number of SPDY server names persisted to prefs file.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfSpdySettings
histogram.summary: The total number of SPDY Settings properties persisted to prefs file.

histogram.name: Net.CRLRequestFailedTimeMs
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to block to fetch one or more revocation lists. This measures the amount of time that failures to get CRL information take.

histogram.name: Net.CRLRequestSuccess
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to block to fetch one or more revocation lists. This records the fraction of successful requests.

histogram.name: Net.CRLRequestTimeMs
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to block to fetch one or more revocation lists. This measures the amount of time that each fetch takes.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadCancelTime
histogram.summary: Measures time from initiating a fetch of a PAC file from DHCP WPAD to cancellation of the fetch. For a given fetch, only one of the cancellation or completion histograms will be added to.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadCompletionTime
histogram.summary: Measures time from initiating a fetch of a PAC file from DHCP WPAD to completion of the fetch. For a given fetch, only one of the cancellation or completion histograms will be added to.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadFetchError
histogram.summary: Tracks the net error codes received when the DHCP WPAD fetch fails to retrieve a PAC file (including PAC_NOT_IN_DHCP, which is not really an error but an indication that a PAC URL was not configured in DHCP).

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadGetAdaptersAddressesError
histogram.summary: Tracks the frequency of each of the different known error codes of calling the GetAdaptersAddresses Win32 API.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadGetAdaptersAddressesTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken to call the GetAdaptersAddresses Win32 API, to validate our understanding that it should complete quickly enough to call synchronously from the network thread.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadNumAdaptersAtWaitTimer
histogram.summary: Total number of adapters enabled for DHCP as seen when the wait timer in the DHCP WPAD code hits. This timer fires after a timeout from when we get some information from the first adapter to finish.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadNumPendingAdaptersAtWaitTimer
histogram.summary: Number of adapters enabled for DHCP that we have not completed retrieving information for, as seen when the wait timer in the DHCP WPAD code hits. This timer fires after a timeout from when we get some information from the first adapter to finish.

histogram.name: Net.DhcpWpadUnhandledDhcpError
histogram.summary: Counts the number of errors from the DhcpRequestParams API that we do not have specific handling for, so that we can see if there is an abnormally high rate.

histogram.name: Net.DNS_Resolution_And_TCP_Connection_Latency2
histogram.summary: The time measured before starting DNS lookup until after the connection is complete.

histogram.name: Net.Dns_Resolution_And_TCP_Connection_Latency2
histogram.summary: The time measured before starting DNS lookup until after the connection is complete.

histogram.name: Net.DoubleGetExperiment_InitialResponseMethod
histogram.summary: The number of HTTP request responses with MS Office Docs MIME types. The responses are classified based on their method type and cacheability (POST, cacheable GET and non-cacheable GET). The histogram is used in Double GET Experiment, where successful non-cacheable GET requests are intercepted after initial response and repeated in order to determine how much reissuing non-cacheable GET requests influences their error rate. The histogram tracks only initial requests (not the repeated ones).

histogram.name: Net.DoubleGetExperiment_ResponseCode
histogram.summary: The response codes encountered for GET request repeated in Double GET Experiment. In the experiment successful non-cacheable GET requests are intercepted after initial response and repeated. The goal of the experiment is to measure how much reissuing non-cacheable GET requests influences their error rate.

histogram.name: Net.DownloadBandwidth
histogram.summary: Kbps on download streams exceeding 25KB. Measures from the beginning of the first byte received until the end of flowing data.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForImages
histogram.summary: Net error codes that requests for images end with, including net::OK and net:ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForMainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2011/5/24, replaced by Net.ErrorCodesForMainFrame2, which measures the same data but uses a different bucket structure (adds guard buckets).
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that a page failed with. Note that this only counts the errors in "main frames", so it is a measure of the error pages that users actually see (it does not for example count the error codes for subresoures on a page).

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForMainFrame2
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2012/5/16, replaced by Net.ErrorCodesForMainFrame3, which measures the same data but includes ERR_ABORTED and OK.
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that a page failed with. Note that this only counts the errors in "main frames", so it is a measure of the error pages that users actually see (it does not for example count the error codes for subresoures on a page).

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForMainFrame3
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that requests for pages end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED. This only counts loads in "main frames" (it does not for example count the error codes for subresoures on a page).

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForSubresources
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2012/5/16, replaced by Net.ErrorCodesForSubresources2, which measures the same data but includes ERR_ABORT and OK.
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that a page failed with. Note that this only counts the errors in "subresources".

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForSubresources2
histogram.summary: Net error codes that requests for "subresources" end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_Flush
histogram.summary: System error code that a file Flush failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_GetSize
histogram.summary: System error code that a file GetSize failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_Open
histogram.summary: System error code that a file Open failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_Read
histogram.summary: System error code that a file Read failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_Seek
histogram.summary: System error code that a file Seek failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_SetEof
histogram.summary: System error code that a file SetEof failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileError_Write
histogram.summary: System error code that a file Write failed with. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_Flush
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file Flush failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_Flush. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_GetSize
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file GetSize failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_GetSize. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_Open
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file Open failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_Open. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_Read
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file Read failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_Read. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_Seek
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file Seek failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_Seek. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_SetEof
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file SetEof failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_SetEof. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileErrorRange_Write
histogram.summary: System error code range that a file Write failed with. Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_Write. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FtpDataConnectionErrorCount
histogram.summary: The number of times each FTP Error was observed.

histogram.name: Net.FtpDataConnectionErrorHappened
histogram.summary: The number of Chrome sessions which encountered the indicates FTP Error. This prevents allowing a user that retried a connection many times (getting an error each time) from biasing the tallies.

histogram.name: Net.FtpServerTypeCount
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of FTP server types the user has encountered during the session.

histogram.name: Net.GetProxyForUrl_FAIL
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for WinHttpGetProxyForUrl to return with error.

histogram.name: Net.GetProxyForUrl_OK
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for WinHttpGetProxyForUrl to return with success.

histogram.name: Net.GoogleConnectionUsedSSLVersionFallback
histogram.summary: Nonzero if the HTTP request was to a Google server which required SSL version fallback. The value indicates the SSL version the request fell back on. Since Google servers support TLS 1.2, any fallback is an indication of network middleware problems.

histogram.name: Net.HadConnectionType
histogram.obsolete: The count was inaccurate (it counted transactions rather than connections).
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a connection of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HadConnectionType2
histogram.obsolete: This statistic measures successful and failed connections, the new one only measures successful ones.
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a connection of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HadConnectionType3
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a successful connection of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HadFtpServerType
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a connection with an FTP server of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCount
histogram.summary: Per-authentication-scheme counts of authentication attempts and rejections.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthResource
histogram.summary: Count of authentication requests for top level pages vs. sub-resources, such as images or iframes.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthTarget
histogram.summary: Per-authentication-scheme counts of authentication targets, such as secure servers or proxies.

histogram.name: Net.HttpConnectionLatency
histogram.summary: Time between the HttpNetworkTransaction requesting a connection and the time it connected.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLength
histogram.summary: Size of the response body. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthDifference
histogram.summary: The difference between the size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header and the size of teh response body. This is zero if the X-Original-Content-Length header is not present in the response.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthDifferenceWithValidOCL
histogram.summary: The difference between the size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header and the size of the response body. Only includes resources that have the X-Original-Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthWithValidOCL
histogram.summary: Size of the response body. Only includes resources that have the X-Original-Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeCached
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs served from the cache.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeCancel
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until the job is killed. Note that we didn't detect the end of the data for this job.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeNotCached
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs not served from the cache.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs when we read until no more data is available.

histogram.name: Net.HttpOriginalContentLength
histogram.summary: Size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header. If this header is not present in the response, the size of the response body is used.

histogram.name: Net.HttpOriginalContentLengthWithValidOCL
histogram.summary: Size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header. Only includes resources that have the X-Original-Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpProxySocketRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to request a new (unused) HTTP proxy socket.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The count of HTTP Response codes encountered.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseCode_Nxx_MainFrame
histogram.summary: The count of HTTP Response codes encountered, in response to MAIN_FRAME requests only; saving only the hundreds digit, e.g. 100->1, 300->3.

histogram.name: Net.HttpSocketType
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets (all HTTP sockets, regardless of any proxy used) used for HTTP[s].

histogram.name: Net.HttpTimeToFirstByte
histogram.summary: Time from when an HTTP request is issued to when the first byte is processed.

histogram.name: Net.IOError_SocketReuseType
histogram.summary: The count of handleable socket errors (connection abort/close/reset) per socket reuse type.

histogram.name: Net.IOError_SocketReuseType_disable_late_binding
histogram.obsolete: Late bindings are on by default now.
histogram.summary: The count of handleable socket errors (connection abort/close/reset) per socket reuse type. Socket late binding is disabled.

histogram.name: Net.IOError_SocketReuseType_enable_late_binding
histogram.obsolete: Late bindings are on by default now.
histogram.summary: The count of handleable socket errors (connection abort/close/reset) per socket reuse type. Socket late binding is enabled.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6Status
histogram.summary: The probe results when a test for IPv6 support is done.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6Status_retest
histogram.summary: The probe results when a test for IPv6 support is done, after a network change event.

histogram.name: Net.MTPR_GetProxyForUrl_Thread_Wait_Time
histogram.summary: The time that a (non-cancelled) proxy resolution request was stalled waiting for an execution thread, for MultiThreadedProxyResolver.

histogram.name: Net.MTPR_GetProxyForUrl_Time
histogram.summary: The total time that it took for a (non-cancelled) proxy resolution request to complete, for MultiThreadedProxyResolver.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsRecovered.MainFrame
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download the main frame of a page in response to specific HTTP network errors succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsRecovered.Subresource
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download a subresource in response to specific HTTP network errors succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsUnrecovered.MainFrame
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download the main frame of a page in response to specific HTTP network errors returns another network error. Histogram includes only the error code that triggered the retry.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsUnrecovered.Subresource
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download a subresource in response to specific HTTP network errors returns another network error. Histogram includes only the error code that triggered the retry.

histogram.name: Net.NotifyAddrChangeFailures
histogram.summary: On Windows, NetworkChangeNotifierWin calls NotifyAddrChange, which can fail for unknown reasons. This records the number of times it fails in a row before a successful call. If it never succeeds, or takes over 100 tries, a value of 100 is recorded. See http://crbug.com/69198

histogram.name: Net.NumDuplicateCookiesInDb
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate cookies that were present in the cookie store during startup.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestFailedTimeMs
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This measures the amount of time that failures to get OCSP information take.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestSuccess
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This records the fraction of successful requests.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestTimeMs
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This measures the amount of time that each of those requests takes.

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()". This error code is platform specific, so when there is a Windows/Linux conflict, both decodings are shown.

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Linux
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Mac
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Win
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectMotivation
histogram.summary: When a preconnection is made, indicate what the motivation was.
histogram.details: Currently, the most common (only?) motivations are SELF_REFERAL, LEARNED_REFERAL and OMNIBOX. The SELF_REFERAL indicates that we made sure a second connection was available for a resource that either was never before seen, or has historically had no subresources. The LEARNED_REFERAL indicates that we "learned" that a subresource was commonly needed, and that motivated the TCP/IP preconnect. The OMNIBOX motivation happens when a search is being suggested, and we preconnect to the search provider. (WARNING: Prior to version 7.517.*, enums 7, 8, and 9 may be confused, as EARLY_LOAD_MOTIVATED was inserted new 6 value.)

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectProxyStatus
histogram.summary: Indicate whether there was a proxy to preclude preconnection.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSubresourceEval
histogram.summary: What did we decide to do about a predicted resource, based on the historical expected number of connection that this subresource will require.
histogram.details: This is basically the current thresholding of the SubresourceExpectation, relative to current static thresholds, and taking into account whether preconnection is enabled (i.e., if preconnection is disabled, we'll never decide to preconnect).

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSubresourceExpectation
histogram.summary: The expected number of connections, times 100, that we'll make to a given subresource, based on learned history.
histogram.details: By comparing this to thresholds, we decide if we will preconnect, preresolve, or do nothing. This histogram can be used to select those static thresholds.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectUtilization
histogram.obsolete: Sourced data corrected, and replaced by NetPreconnectUtilization2
histogram.summary: Indicate final utilization for each attempted socket connection.
histogram.details: We also include stats for non-speculative sockets. Some socket connections may never connect, and others may never be used (as the user may abort before then).

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectUtilization2
histogram.summary: Indicate final utilization for each attempted socket connection.
histogram.details: We also include stats for non-speculative sockets. Some socket connections may never connect, and others may never be used (as the user may abort before then).

histogram.name: Net.Priority_High_Latency
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for high priority (currently frame and subframe) requests. Only times under 10 minutes are recorded.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_High_Latency_b
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for high priority (currently frame and subframe) requests.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_Low_Latency
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for low priority (non-frame/subframe) requests. Only times under 10 minutes are recorded.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_Low_Latency_b
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for low priority (non-frame/subframe) requests.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyPollConfigurationTime
histogram.summary: The time in milliseconds spent fetch the system proxy configuration, when polling it for changes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.AbandonedExecutionTotalTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent executing the proxy script during "tracing" runs (executions of the script which discovered a new DNS dependency and were subsequently abandoned).

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.AbandonedExecutionTotalTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent executing the proxy script during "tracing" runs (executions of the script which discovered a new DNS dependency and were subsequently abandoned).

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.DnsWaitTotalTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent in the non-blocking DNS bindings while executing PAC scripts. This includes the times for abandoned executions.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.ExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time inside of V8 that the proxy script spent executing for the final pass. This includes the time spent in the javascript bindings. This does not include the time spent in abandoned execution passes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumAlerts
histogram.summary: The number of times that alert() was called in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumErrors
histogram.summary: The number of errors that were seen in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumRestarts
histogram.summary: The number of times that the PAC script execution was restarted.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.TotalTime
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.TotalTimeDNS
histogram.summary: The total time that proxy resolution spent waiting for DNS. This also includes any queuing delays on the origin thread waiting for the DNS result to be processed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.UniqueDNS
histogram.summary: The number of unique DNS hostnames that the PAC script tried to resolve. The *Ex() versions of the bindings count separately.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.DnsWaitTotalTime
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent in the non-blocking DNS bindings while executing PAC scripts. This includes the times for abandoned executions.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.ExecutionTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time inside of V8 that the proxy script spent executing for the final pass. This includes the time spent in the javascript bindings (which is probably dominated by Net.ProxyResolver.DnsWaitTotalTime). This does not include the time spent in abandoned execution passes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumAlerts
histogram.summary: The number of times that alert() was called in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumErrors
histogram.summary: The number of errors that were seen in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumRestarts
histogram.summary: The number of times that the PAC script execution was restarted.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.OriginThreadLatency
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took upon completion to run the final task posted back to the IO thread.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTime
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTimeDNS
histogram.summary: The total time that proxy resolution spent waiting for DNS. This also includes any queuing delays on the origin thread waiting for the DNS result to be processed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTimeWorkerThread
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took, not including the post back to the origin thread. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.UniqueDNS
histogram.summary: The number of unique DNS hostnames that the PAC script tried to resolve. The *Ex() versions of the bindings count separately.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinFailureDomain
histogram.summary: Second-level domains for which we have observed public key pinning failures.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinSuccess
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional "pinning" requirements on a per-domain basis. This records the fraction of successful matches between a certificate chain and a pin list.

histogram.name: Net.RenegotiationExtensionSupported
histogram.summary: True if the HTTP request was sent to a server which supports the TLS renegotiation extension.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.summary: The time an already used socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.summary: The time an unused socket (all HTTP sockets, regardless of any proxy used) sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeOnIOError2_ReusedSocket
histogram.summary: The time a previously used socket sat idle before encountering a recoverable socket IO error (connection abort/reset/close).

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeOnIOError2_UnusedSocket
histogram.summary: The time an unused socket sat idle before encountering a recoverable socket IO error (connection abort/reset/close).

histogram.name: Net.SocketInitErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Net error codes that socket initializations end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.SocketRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from initial RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected socket.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionEstablish
histogram.summary: The time from the connection start to connection establish.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionLatency
histogram.summary: The time waiting to be ready to start connecting.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionType
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of connection type of socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.Duration

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Latency_IPv6_Solo
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when the network address only contains IPv6 addresses. Only times under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21
histogram.summary: In this experiment, 21 packets were sent to Google via UDP at port 6121 as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram. If the port is not blocked, then this histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
histogram.summary: In this experiment, 21 packets were sent to Google via UDP at port 6121 as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21.GotAnAck
histogram.summary: In this experiment, 21 packets were sent to Google via UDP at port 6121 as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked. The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.UDP.PacketLoss
histogram.summary: Chrome sends 4 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if packets 1 and 3 are received, but packets 2 and 4 are lost, then we'd record a sample of binary 0101B, or 5.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.UDP.PacketLoss6
histogram.summary: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.
