histogram.name: Network.Cellular.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using Cellular to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a 3G/Cellular network and configure Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a 3G/Cellular network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a 3G/Cellular network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Cellular.UsageRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular usage API request status codes.

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using Ethernet to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Ethernet.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.ServiceErrors
histogram.summary: Chrome OS connection manager service errors seen.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.AutoConnectTotalTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total amount of time spent from the start of the first auto-connect request until when the cellular modem successfully connects to the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.AutoConnectTries
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of auto-connect tries that were attempted before the cellular modem successfully connected to the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.Disconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks whether the cellular network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.Drop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular network metric that tracks the number of drops based on the network technology.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.OutOfCreditsReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular network metric that tracks the number of out-of-credits detected based on the cause that triggered the out-of-credits.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalAttempts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of portal detection attempts per pass for a cellular network. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalAttemptsToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total number of portal detection attempts performed for a cellular network between the Connected and Online state. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.PortalResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for a cellular network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.SignalStrengthBeforeDrop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the signal strength (0-100) of the cellular modem before it dropped from the network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using cellular to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a cellular network and configure Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToConnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to connect a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToDisable
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to disable a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToEnable
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to enable a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize a cellular modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a cellular network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.TimeToScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to scan a cellular network and register a modem.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.CorruptedProfile
histogram.summary: Chrome OS cellular network metric that tracks the number of corrupted profiles encountered by Shill.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.Disconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks whether the Ethernet network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorBroadcastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor broadcast errors that were accrued on an Ethernet network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric that signals the type of failure the LinkMonitor encountered which caused it to stop monitoring an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorResponseTimeSample
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of milliseconds between an ARP request and a received reply on an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorSecondsToFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of seconds from the start of the LinkMonitor until failure on an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.LinkMonitorUnicastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor unicast errors that were accrued on an Ethernet network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalAttempts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of portal detection attempts per pass for an Ethernet network. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalAttemptsToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total number of portal detection attempts performed for an Ethernet network between the Connected and Online state. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.PortalResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for an Ethernet network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using Ethernet to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize an Ethernet device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an Ethernet network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.ServiceErrors
histogram.summary: Chrome OS connection manager service errors seen.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult.OnSuspend
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult.OnTerminate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime.OnSuspend
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime.OnTerminate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TimeToDrop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network stability metric sampling the time in seconds between the networking going online to going offline. Offline events due to device shutdown or suspend are ignored (along with the online time before that offline event).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.Driver
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the VPN connection type.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.RemoteAuthenticationType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the remote authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.VPN.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on a VPN network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.VPN.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a WiMax network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Vpn.UserAuthenticationType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful VPN connection that tracks the user authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Reason code reported when the AP disconnects a wifi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ApDisconnectType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Broad category of reason AP disconnected a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Channel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ClientDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Reason code reported when the client disconnects a wifi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.ClientDisconnectType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. Broad category of reason client disconnected a WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Disconnect
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric that tracks whether an 802.11 wireless network was disconnected due to an error or was explicitly disconnected by the user.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.EapInnerProtocol
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful 802.1x wireless connection that tracks the configured inner authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.EapOuterProtocol
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric sampled on each successful 802.1x wireless connection that tracks the configured outer authentication method.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.FrequenciesConnectedEver
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of different WiFi frequencies to which the user's machine has ever connected.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorBroadcastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor broadcast errors that were accrued on an 802.11 wireiless network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric that signals the type of failure the LinkMonitor encountered which caused it to stop monitoring an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorResponseTimeSample
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of milliseconds between an ARP request and a received reply on an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorSecondsToFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of seconds from the start of the LinkMonitor until failure on an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.LinkMonitorUnicastErrorsAtFailure
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the number of LinkMonitor unicast errors that were accrued on an 802.11 wireless network at the time that the link was declaired to be failed.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PhyMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel type used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalAttempts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of portal detection attempts per pass for an 802.11 wireless network. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalAttemptsToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the total number of portal detection attempts performed for an 802.11 wireless network between the Connected and Online state. This includes failure, timeout and successful attempts.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.PortalResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the result of portal detections for an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.Security
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The security setting for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.SignalStrength
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric indicating the negative of the dBm received signal strength recorded at the time a successful WiFi connection started.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using WiFi to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeResumeToReady
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time from the resume event to the time when an 802.11 wireless network has configured its Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize an 802.11 wireless device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToJoin
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.TimeToScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to scan WiFi until a connection is found.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiMax.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on a WiMax network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiMax.TimeToInitialize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize a WiMax device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiMax.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a WiMax network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Cellular
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a 3G/Cellular network and configure Layer 3 state. Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Cellular.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Ethernet
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease). Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Ethernet.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Wifi
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease). Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Wifi.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToDrop
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network stability metric sampling the time in seconds between the networking going online to going offline. Offline events due to device shutdown or suspend are ignored (along with the online time before that offline event).

histogram.name: Network.TimeToJoin.Wifi
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network. Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Wifi.TimeToJoin.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.AuthMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.BitRate
histogram.summary: Network metric reporting the download speed test results run at setup time. Recorded at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Channel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Idle.NoiseLevel
histogram.summary: Network metric indicating the negative of the dBm noise level recorded at the time the metric is collected. Reported at least once per day and only when the device is idle.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Idle.SignalLevel
histogram.summary: Network metric indicating the negative of the dBm received signal level recorded at the time the metric is collected. Reported at least once per day and only when the device is idle.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Idle.SignalToNoiseRatio
histogram.summary: Network metric indicating signal minus noise in dBm recorded at the time the metrics is collected. Reported at least once per day and only when the device is idle.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.NoiseLevel
histogram.summary: Network metric indicating the negative of the dBm noise level recorded at the time the metric is collected. Reported at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.PhyMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The channel type used for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.RoundTripTime
histogram.summary: Network metric reporting the average round trip time to the wifi gateway. Recorded at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.Security
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The security setting for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.SignalLevel
histogram.summary: Network metric indicating the negative of the dBm received signal level recorded at the time the metric is collected. Reported at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.SignalToNoiseRatio
histogram.summary: Network metric indicating signal minus noise in dBm recorded at the time the metrics is collected. Reported at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using WiFi to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeResumeToReady
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time from the resume event to the time when an 802.11 wireless network has configured its Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToConfig
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToJoin
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToOnline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToPortal
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: OfflinePolicy.SuccessfulResourceLoadPercentage
histogram.summary: When a page is loaded in offline mode, the percentage of resources on that page that were successfully loaded.

histogram.name: Omnibox.AggressiveHistoryURLProviderFieldTrialBeacon
histogram.obsolete: Aggressive HistoryURL provider field trial deleted in spring 2012.
histogram.summary: A number that indicates what omnibox ranking behavior the user is seeing as part of the OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider field trial (OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider).

histogram.name: Omnibox.EnteredKeywordMode
histogram.summary: The number of times users enter keyword hint mode "Search ___ for:" and how.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryBookmarksTime
histogram.summary: Time the HistoryContentProvider takes to perform a bookmark search.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to become responsive to user input after the user has typed N characters. This measures the time it takes to start all the asynchronous autocomplete providers (but not wait for them to finish).

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchEngine
histogram.summary: The id of search engine that was used for search in omnibox. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/template_url_prepopulate_data.cc for more info.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Failure.GoogleResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of a suggest request to Google until the time the request was returned with status==failed. Ignores requests that were canceled before being returned.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Success.GoogleResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of a suggest request to Google until the time the request was returned with status==success. Ignores requests that were canceled before being returned.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequests
histogram.summary: Counts about the number of suggest requests the omnibox sent, invalidated, and replies received.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Completed
histogram.summary: Completed overscroll gestures.
histogram.details: An overscroll gesture starts when user scrolls past the edge of the web page and continues scrolling in the same direction. An overscroll gesture is completed when user stops scrolling (e.g. by lifting the fingers from the touchscreen or touchpad).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overcroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: Platform.AsvGroup
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (ARM Chromebooks using Exynos 5250 only) Adaptive Support Voltage Group, recorded once per bootup. Indicates which "bin" the SoC is part of, which sets the voltage that different rails on the system will run at. The values 0-11 are valid. A value of 12 indicates an error parsing dmesg and should be investigated. See also Platform.LotIdEnum.

histogram.name: Platform.BootSectorsRead
histogram.summary: Chrome OS number of disk sectors read at boot from kernel start to login-prompt-ready.

histogram.name: Platform.BootSectorsWritten
histogram.summary: Chrome OS number of disk sectors written at boot from kernel start to login-prompt-ready.

histogram.name: Platform.CompressedSwapSize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of allocated swap area in megabytes (before compression)

histogram.name: Platform.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: Peak total (single core) CPU usage for the last sample interval. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.CrOSEvent
histogram.summary: Generic event of interest from Chrome OS. Intended mainly to help assess the frequency of rare error conditions.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageCache
histogram.summary: KB in use in the /cache filesystem tree. Logged once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageChronos
histogram.summary: Chrome OS KB in use in the /home/chronos filesystem tree. Logged once a day during log file cleanup.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageData
histogram.summary: KB in use in the /data filesystem tree. Logged once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageVar
histogram.summary: Chrome OS KB in use in the /var filesystem tree. Logged once a day during log file cleanup.

histogram.name: Platform.IntelMaxMicroArchitecture
histogram.summary: The maximum supported micro-architecture on an Intel platform. This value is logged at program start time.

histogram.name: Platform.LotIdEnum
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (ARM Chromebooks using Exynos 5250 only) indication about whether we're part of a special lot ID. Special lot IDs are groups of chips that have special case handling in the kernel for the Adaptive Support Voltage code (the normal logic doesn't work). See also Platform.AsvGroup. Note that fused devices are never part of a special lot (currently) and only some unfused lots are "special".

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoActive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of active memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoActiveAnon
histogram.summary: Chrome OS active anonymous memory (data segments) as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoActiveFile
histogram.summary: Chrome OS active file-backed memory (executables, ...) as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoAnonPages
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of anonymous memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoBuffers
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of buffer cache as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoCached
histogram.summary: Chrome OS: size of file-backed memory minus swap and buffer cache, as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoInactive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of inactive memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoInactiveAnon
histogram.summary: Chrome OS inactive anonymous memory (data segments) as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoInactiveFile
histogram.summary: Chrome OS inactive file-backed memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoMapped
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of mapped memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoMemFree
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of free memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoShmem
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of shared memory in Kbytes.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoSlab
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of slab memory in Kbytes.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoSwapUsed
histogram.summary: Chrome OS amount of swapped-out memory in Kbytes. These, and all other MEMINFO stats, are snapshotted every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoSwapUsedPercent
histogram.summary: Chrome OS amount of swapped-out memory as % of total RAM. These, and all other MEMINFO stats, are snapshotted every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoUnevictable
histogram.summary: Chrome OS unevictable memory (ramfs, SHM_LOCKED, mlocked) in Kbytes.

histogram.name: Platform.MemoryBandwidth.ReadWrite
histogram.summary: Peak memory bandwith (read and write) usage during the last sample interval. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon0
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 1 minute after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon1
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 5 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon2
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 30 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon3
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 150 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon4
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 750 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.PageFaultsLong
histogram.summary: Page faults per second averaged over 30s interval, sampled continuously.

histogram.name: Platform.PageFaultsShort
histogram.summary: Page faults per second averaged over 1s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ReadSectorsLong
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second read by Chrome OS in a long interval (currently 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.ReadSectorsShort
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second read by Chrome OS in a short interval (currently 1s, sampled every 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.SmartTransferErrors
histogram.summary: Disk communication errors (SMART 199), sent at boot.

histogram.name: Platform.SmartUncorrectableErrors
histogram.summary: Uncorrectable disk errors (SMART 187), sent at boot.

histogram.name: Platform.StatefulUsage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS stateful partition usage level.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Junction
histogram.summary: Peak junction temperature for the last sample interval, read from TSEN on the SoC. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor00
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 0 (I2C_CPU-Die) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor01
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 1 (I2C_CPU-Object) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor02
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 2 (I2C_PCH-Die) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor03
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 3 (I2C_PCH-Object) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor04
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 4 (I2C_DDR-Die) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor05
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 5 (I2C_DDR-Object) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor06
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 6 (Charger-Die), taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor07
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 7 (Charger-Object) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor08
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 8 (ECInternal) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.Temperature.Sensor09
histogram.summary: Temperature reading at sensor 9 (PECI) taken every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.TPMForcedReboot
histogram.summary: Each sample is the number of consecutive reboots performed while attempting to clear a TPM (Trusted Platform Module) error.

histogram.name: Platform.WriteSectorsLong
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second written by Chrome OS in a long interval (currently 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.WriteSectorsShort
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second written by Chrome OS in a short interval (currently 1s, sampled every 30s)

histogram.name: PlatformFile.UnknownCreateFileErrors
histogram.summary: Errors returned by CreateFile on windows that PlatformFileError doesn't yet support.

histogram.name: PLT.Abandoned
histogram.summary: Distribution of actual finished pages, vs abandoned pages, where we needed to declare a finish time prematurely since the page was being closed (exited).

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFinish_ContentPrefetcher
histogram.summary: PLT.BeginToFinish, but for pages which contained prefetch links.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFinish_ContentPrefetcherReferrer
histogram.summary: PLT.BeginToFinish, but for pages which were referred to by pages which contained prefetch links.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFinishDoc_ContentPrefetcher
histogram.summary: PLT.BeginToFinishDoc, but for pages which contained prefetch links.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFinishDoc_ContentPrefetcherReferrer
histogram.summary: PLT.BeginToFinishDoc, but for pages which were referred to by pages which contained prefetch links.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.LoadType
histogram.summary: Probability distribution for enumerated varieties of page loads.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPLT.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime_PrerenderLoad
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request" == time when user requested document. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToCommit
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiBrokerLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a PPAPI broker.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiPluginLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: Power.BacklightLevelOnAC
histogram.summary: The level of the backlight as a percentage when the user is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BacklightLevelOnBattery
histogram.summary: The level of the backlight as a percentage when the user is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryChargeHealth
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery charge health percentage. Sampled once when device starts charging.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery discharge rate in mW sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryInfoSample
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times we have read the battery status from sysfs and if it gave us sensible values.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtEndOfSessionOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the end of a user session when the device is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtEndOfSessionOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the end of a user session when the device is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtStartOfSessionOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the start of a user session when the device is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtStartOfSessionOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the start of a user session when the device is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingCharge
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingWhenChargeStarts
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled when charging starts.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryTimeToEmpty
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining time to empty battery in minutes sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BitfixChunks
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (Snow RO firmware 2695.90.0 only) number of 8K chunks that were fixed (memory corruption corrected) for each suspend/resume cycle. Expect 0 around 97% of the time and a non-zero value around 3% of the time.

histogram.name: Power.BitfixFixes
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (Snow RO firmware 2695.90.0 only) number of 4-byte words that were fixed (memory corruption corrected) for each suspend/resume cycle. Expect 0 around 97% of the time and a non-zero value around 3% of the time. Would be exactly equal to Power.BitfixChunks if there were only one corrupted word in each chunk but is sometimes several times higher.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnAC
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on battery power.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnBattery
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on AC power.

histogram.name: Power.FirmwareResumeTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: The time that the firmware took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on AC at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.FirmwareResumeTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: The time that the firmware took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on battery at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterDimOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen dimmed sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterDimOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen dimmed sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterScreenOffOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen turned off sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterScreenOffOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen turned off sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.KernelResumeTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on AC at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.KernelResumeTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on battery at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.KernelSuspendTimeOnAC
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to suspend-to-RAM the Chrome OS device when running on AC.

histogram.name: Power.KernelSuspendTimeOnBattery
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to suspend-to-RAM the Chrome OS device when running on battery.

histogram.name: Power.LengthOfSession
histogram.summary: The length of time, in seconds, that a user spent in a single session. Values for this metric are clamped to 12 hours, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 12 hours.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourIosOnActive
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator listens to on_application_active events. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourOthers
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, for other sync invalidator methods. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourP2P
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator uses peer-to-peer notifications. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourServer
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator uses server-based non-blocking invalidator. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.NumberOfAlsAdjustmentsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of times that the Automatic Light Sensor (ALS) adjusted the brightness during a session. Values for this metric are clamped to 10k count, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 10k.

histogram.name: Power.NumberOfSessionsPerCharge
histogram.summary: The number of user sessions that occured since the last time that the device was charged. Values for this metric are clamped at 10k, so the last bucket should be considered to include all metrics about 10k.

histogram.name: Power.RetrySuspendCount
histogram.summary: The number of times Chrome OS retried suspend due to previous failure.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendStatus
histogram.summary: ChromeOS suspend status - either success, failure, or cancelled.

histogram.name: Power.ThermalAbortedFanTurnOn
histogram.summary: The percentage of aborted fan attempts out of total fan attempts per session, where an abort is due to hysteresis. This value is computed from boot and sent when powerd starts and then every 15 minutes afterwards.

histogram.name: Power.ThermalMultipleFanTurnOn
histogram.summary: The percentage of fan trip point passes that are more than one trip point. This value is computed from boot and sent when powerd starts and then every 15 minutes afterwards.

histogram.name: Power.TimeInSuspendAtBoot
histogram.summary: Chrome OS time in minutes spent in suspend-to-RAM mode sampled at boot (i.e., the device most likely ran out of battery while in suspend).

histogram.name: Power.TimeInSuspendAtResume
histogram.summary: Chrome OS time in minutes spent in suspend-to-RAM mode sampled at resume.

histogram.name: Power.UserBrightnessAdjustmentsPerSessionOnAC
histogram.summary: The number of times that the user adjusted the brightness during a session when on AC. Values for this metric are clamped to 10k count, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 10k.

histogram.name: Power.UserBrightnessAdjustmentsPerSessionOnBattery
histogram.summary: The number of times that the user adjusted the brightness during a session when on battery. Values for this metric are clamped to 10k count, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 10k.

histogram.name: Prerender.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Final status for prerender pages - either success, or why it was canceled.

histogram.name: Prerender.FinalStatusMatchComplete
histogram.summary: Final status for prerender pages - either success, or why it was canceled. This is for the MatchComplete set of pages (including some pages that were not actually prerendered), to match the control group.

histogram.name: Prerender.FractionPixelsFinalAtSwapin
histogram.summary: For prerenders that are swapped in, the percentage of pixels that is already final at swap-in time compared to when the spinner stops.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorEvent
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to the local predictor have occurred

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLT
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMiss
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for the first page load completing immediately after a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissAnyOnly
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where only Any triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissBoth
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where both triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissNonOverlapping
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for the first page load completing immediately after a prerender, but which has also started after the prerender has been initiated.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissNonOverlappingOnly
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where only Non-overlapping triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTMatched
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded only for prerendered pages, or for pages which would have been prerendered in the control case.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTMatchedComplete
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded only for prerendered pages, or for pages which would have been prerendered in the control case.
In MatchedComplete, the prerender group also contains cancelled prerenders, so as to produce a perfect match of page views attributed this group in the prerender group with those attributed to this group in the control group.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTWindowed
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all page loads which happen within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is observed.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTWindowNotMatched
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all page loads which happen within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is observed and which do not correspond to a prerender tag.

histogram.name: Prerender.PercentLoadDoneAtSwapin
histogram.summary: For prerenders that are swapped in, the percentage of the time from load start until the onload event fires that has elapsed at the time of the swapin.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderCountOf3Max
histogram.summary: After launching a prerender, how many simultanious prerenders are recorded as running, out of a maximum of three.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderNotSwappedInPLT
histogram.summary: For prerenders that finish loading before they are ever swapped in, their page load time until the onload event fires.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererIdleTime
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page finishes loading to when it is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. When a page is displayed before it finishes loading, no value is recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLT
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page, as measured by the renderer process. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererTimeUntilDisplay
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between when the prerendering of a page starts and when the page is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. Prerendered pages discarded without being displayed are excluded from this count.

histogram.name: Prerender.SimulatedLocalBrowsingBaselinePLT
histogram.summary: For simulated local browsing prerendering, the baseline PLT of pages without any prerendering for pages that would be prerendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.SimulatedLocalBrowsingPLT
histogram.summary: For simulated local browsing prerendering, the estimated PLT of pages with prerendering enabled for pages that would be prerendered.

histogram.name: Renderer.PixelIncreaseFromTransitions
histogram.summary: A lower-bound on the percentage increase in memory that would result from promoting all layers that have a webkit-transition on opacity or transform.

histogram.name: Renderer2.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.summary: The time from when a document finished loading to when all it's resources are also loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFinish_L
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToStart
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it starts loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinish
histogram.summary: The time from when a page started loading to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to when the main document is finished loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Abandoned
histogram.summary: Distribution of actual finished pages, vs abandoned pages, where we needed to declare a finish time prematurely since the page was being closed (exited).

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToFinish
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.DismissalState
histogram.summary: The state of the requestAutocomplete() dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.InitialUserState
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.PopupInDialog
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.Security
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the RequestAutocomplete dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiEvents
histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the requestAutocomplete() dialog UI.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the requestAutocomplete() UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletErrors
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: SB.BloomFilter
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB.BuildBloom
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB.Database
histogram.summary: The second stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database.

histogram.name: SB.DBCheck
histogram.summary: The second stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database. This time includes the filter check time.

histogram.name: SB.Delay
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.FilterCheck
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory hash table.

histogram.name: SB.Network
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL.

histogram.name: SB.NetworkCheck
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL. This time includes the filter and database check time.

histogram.name: SB.PauseSafe
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.Update
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB2.AddPrefixes
histogram.summary: The number of add prefixes stored in the database after the last update.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFailure
histogram.summary: Track failures when in processing the safe-browsing database bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives
histogram.summary: All prefix misses (server returned no full hashes) and prefix misses due to false positives in the bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB2.BloomFilterLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the BloomFilter file.

histogram.name: SB2.BrowseDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the browsing SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildFilter
histogram.summary: The time that it took to regenerate the filter after we have received all the update chunks.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.BuildReadKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read by the browser process during the bloom filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadKilobytes
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes read by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildReadOperations
histogram.summary: The number of read operations issued by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.BuildWriteKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes written by the browser process during the bloom filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteKilobytes
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes written by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.BuildWriteOperations
histogram.summary: The number of write operations issued by the browser process during the filter generation phase.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkInsert
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to write one redirect URL (which can contain multiple chunks) to the database.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkRequest
histogram.summary: The network time between the request and response for a chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.ChunkSize
histogram.summary: The size of one chunk URL.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseBytes
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.DatabaseKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseFailure
histogram.summary: Track failures when updating the safe-browsing database.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseOpen
histogram.summary: The time it takes to initialize the SafeBrowsing storage backend, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseUpdateKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the update file before merging with the database file, in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.Delay
histogram.summary: The time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadChecks
histogram.summary: Records results of SafeBrowsing download check, including both url check and downloaded file hash check.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the downloads SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a download to finish.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadHashCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check hash of a download file.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlCheckDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for SafeBrowsing to check a download url.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadUrlChecks
histogram.summary: Records results of SafeBrowsing download url check.

histogram.name: SB2.FailedUpdate
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times an update failed when being committed to the database.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterCheck
histogram.summary: The time that it took to check a URL against our in-memory filter.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the current bloom filter in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterLoad
histogram.summary: Which filter file the database loaded from disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterMissing
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times we attempted to load the bloom filter file but it was missing.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterReadFail
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times we attempted to load the bloom filter file but failed while reading the file on disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterSize
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated because it was exceeding the range. Replaced by SB2.FilterKilobytes.
histogram.summary: The size of the current bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB2.FilterWriteFail
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times we attempted to save the bloom filter file but failed while writing the file to disk.

histogram.name: SB2.FormatEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks events involved in upgrading safe-browsing data from SQLite format to new file format.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash200
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_200.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned data (valid requests).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash204
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_204.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned empty data (false positives).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash requests to server (STATUS_200 and STATUS_204), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus those 200 responses corrosponding to items deleted on the server but not yet deleted on the client. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResultDownload
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash requests to server (STATUS_200 and STATUS_204), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus those 200 responses corrosponding to items deleted on the server but not yet deleted on the client. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashServerMiss
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult FULL_HASH_* and SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives. It is unclear if this histogram ever reported useful data.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests returning full hashes that didn't match the URL that initiated the request.

histogram.name: SB2.HandleCorrupt
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times a database was found corrupt and reset.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialAction
histogram.summary: Track number of times Safe Browsing interstitials have been shown, and how many times they have been clicked through or not.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeDiagnostic
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on diagnostic page link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore

histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more about malware link.

histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetBitsPerPrefix
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet storage in bits, divided by the number of prefixes represented. Should almost always be 16.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetEvent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 9/2012. No longer generated, BloomFilter being removed.
histogram.summary: Records how well the PrefixSet implementation matches the BloomFilter implementation.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet file in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredExcess
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many extra results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredShortfall
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many fewer results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDelta
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far unsorted deltas are from expected value.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDifference
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Distance of unsorted elements from expected location.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedPercent
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far into the results unsorted elements were found. Interesting values would be 0%, 50%, or 100%.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedSize

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetWrite

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CheckDownloadStats
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of the reason why downloads are marked as being malicious or clean by the improved SafeBrowsing binary download protection.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadExtensions
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of how often users download a file with a file extension that is possibly dangerous (e.g., exe, class).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to check whether the content of a download is malicious or not. This histogram only includes requests that are sent to the SafeBrowsing server.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedBinaryDownload
histogram.summary: Records the number of signed vs. unsigned executables that are downloaded.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedOrWhitelistedDownload
histogram.summary: Counter which is incremented whenever an executable is downloaded which is either signed or whose URL matches the download whitelist.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CancelClassificationReason
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why an in-progress phishing classification was canceled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CheckNoPendingClassificationFailed
histogram.summary: The number of times client-side phishing classifier expected to have no pending classifications running but that check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClassificationStart
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientPhishing enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientModelStatus
histogram.summary: The counts for various model status codes that we get after loading a new client-side phishing model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureChunkTime
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of DOM feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureFrameRemoved
histogram.summary: The number of times that DOM feature extraction finished early because the active WebDocument's frame was removed during traversal.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureIterations
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the DOM feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureResumeTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took to resume DOM feature extraction for the phishing classifier. Longer times may indicate that the page DOM changed between chunks of work and the extractor had to re-traverse up to the saved position.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because DOM feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTotalTime
histogram.summary: The time that the DOM feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.GrabPhishingThumbnail
histogram.summary: Time spent generating the thumbnail.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.IllegalFeatureValue
histogram.summary: The number of features which were omitted from phishing classification because they were added with an illegal value. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InitPrivateNetworksFailed
histogram.summary: The number of times that the phishing detection service could not be initialized due to an error parsing the private IP networks. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InvalidWhitelistExpression
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. Whitelist entries are no longer part of ClientPhishingResponse.
histogram.summary: The number of whitelist_expression entries in a ClientPhishingResponse that could not be canonicalized.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.summary: Records the number of phishing classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ReportLimitSkipped
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were previously cached as being phishing but that will get re-classified (to possibly fix false positives).

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestNotSerialized
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifier pingbacks that were skipped because serializing the request protocol buffer to string failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestSatisfiedFromCache
histogram.summary: The number of times that a cached phishing classification result was used, rather than pinging the server.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ScorerCreationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status when we create a scorer object for the client-side phishing detection classifier.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureBreakIterError
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because the term feature extractor failed to initialize an ICU break iterator.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureChunkTime
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of term feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureIterations
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the term feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTimeout
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classification that were aborted because term feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTotalTime
histogram.summary: The time that the term feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TooManyFeatures
histogram.summary: The number of times that the limit on the number of phishing classifier features for a page was reached. This may indicate a bug, or that kMaxFeatureSize is too small.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.URLFeatureTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract URL features for the phishing classifier.
